definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Be on time to meetings-early if you can.
sentences.chinese: 开会记得准时，能早点到更好。

sentences.english: Hey Lowy. What?Do you want to open your birthday present early?
sentences.chinese: 你想早点打开你的生日礼物吗？

sentences.english: If I had left sooner, I'd have caught the bus.
sentences.chinese: 早点动身，我就赶上巴士了。

sentences.english: So tell early poetry tile you want to return to Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 于是告诉诗瓦自己想早点回到泰国。

sentences.english: Remember sleeping earlier oh, slept at 10 o'clock but hairdressing becomes aware.
sentences.chinese: 记得早点睡哟，10点睡的可是美容觉。

sentences.english: Would you mind coming earlier tomorrow?
I whish I could, but the people's tastes for garments change so fast.
sentences.chinese: 我希望早点订货，但人们对服装的喜好变化太快。

sentences.english: Come earlier next time. Don't be late any more.
sentences.chinese: 下次早点来，别再迟到了。

sentences.english: You'll have to book early if you want to see that fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 你要想看那场时装表演的话，就得早点儿定座位。

sentences.english: Wuhan will use the earlier, called "premature."
sentences.chinese: 武汉人将用早点，称为“过早”。

sentences.english: You weselves go apatment a bit earlier nowadays, weselvesn'tyou?
sentences.chinese: 当今你能够早点儿回家，是并非？

sentences.english: You'd better check in early to get a good seat on your flight.
sentences.chinese: 你最好早点办登机手续，这样可以坐到好座位。

sentences.english: I've to get up early tomorrow so that I can catch the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 为了赶上头班车我明天得起得早点。

sentences.english: But you never give me any notice. You just think I'm at your beck and call.
sentences.chinese: 但你从来不早点通知我，你以为我是随传随到。

definition: to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
erhua variant of 快點|快点[kuai4 dian3]
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
at ease/to feel relieved/to set one's mind at rest/to keep one's mind on sth
